Activity: Arrive at the office, grab a coffee, and check emails and messages. Check for updates from Leon @LDES-1 and Naomi @NDES-1.
Collaborate closely with Leon @LDES-1 and Naomi @NDES-1 to ensure the UI reflects the game's world and narrative. Schedule a meeting to discuss the overall vision for the UI.
Attend the meeting with Leon @LDES-1 and Naomi @NDES-1. Discuss the game's world, narrative, and target audience. Brainstorm ideas for the UI design.
Based on the meeting, create a mood board for the UI design. Gather inspiration from other games, movies, and art styles. Share the mood board with Leon @LDES-1 and Naomi @NDES-1 for feedback.
Start designing the UI elements based on the mood board. Focus on creating a consistent and immersive experience for the player.
Lunch Break. Go out for a walk with colleagues and enjoy the sunshine.
Implement the new UI designs in the game. Replace the placeholder graphics with the final assets from the art team.
Add animations and sound effects to the UI elements. Make sure that the UI is responsive and intuitive to use.
Test the UI thoroughly to ensure that it is working correctly. Fix any bugs or issues that are found.
Commit the changes to the version control system. Write a detailed commit message explaining the changes made.
Plan for tomorrow, review the completed tasks. Do some documentation for today's codes.
